Call your legislator today.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

On Tuesday, December 4, Wisconsin lawmakers will suddenly have to consider hundreds of pages of changes to the law that legislative leaders only revealed late on Friday. These proposals would harm Wisconsin families by changing laws affecting health insurance, elections, and more. This includes limiting early voting and an expensive plan to add a third spring election to the 2020 election calendar, making Wisconsin residents vote three times in the space of just three months.

Drafting sweeping legislation behind closed doors to change the rules after an election violates the public's trust, as well as our First Amendment rights to know and be heard. This limits democracy and our ability to hold elected officials accountable.

Moving the presidential primary would require adding a third election to the spring 2020 line-up between the regularly scheduled February primary and April election. Asking local officials to hold a series of elections — each in February, March, and April — makes no sense. County and municipal clerks from around the state are opposing the proposal because of the high cost and complications for local governments.

Call your state senator and assembly representative and urge them not to let power-hungry legislators ignore election results and push voters around.

Find Your Legislator

You can also reach your legislators by calling 833-257-2258.

The legislature's drastic and extreme action seeks to unfairly rush through laws that could be considered during regular session. Their current strategy actively undermines the democratic process and the rights of Wisconsin residents.

Let's return to Wisconsin values of openness and fair play.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Wisconsin
